reviews.review:
Above average movie  don't watch it legally 
Worst ending ever
Jaw dropping. I left the theater in tears.

Honestly? I adore Marvel but this was so underwhelming for me. This was essentially a two hour punch up with very little actual story line. After seeing the movie, I can understand how half of the cast managed to shoot without readin the script - with the exception of Thanos and the Guardians (and perhaps Tony) the remaining cast had, at best, 8-9 lines each. 
The last time we saw Cap, he was still Cap - this time we see him, star ripped from his chest but not once a mention of the name Nomad. Infact we dont really know anything about where he has been or what hes been doing. The last time we saw Wanda and Vision they were eating paprikash - now theyre in bed. Gatorade and Peter were last talking about their 'unspoken thing' - now they're making out and in love. All interesting little elements that we completely skip over.
The Black Order were under powered and underwhelming. With the exception of Maw, the other members were weak, forgettable and not particularly well introduced. I don't remember actually hearing Proxima Midnights name in the whole movie.
Finally, the ending was just so...depressing. It was also hugely unconvincing. Nothing here is at risk, as we know that the 'newer' cast members have upcoming movies and remaining movie contracts therefore confirming that they haven't really died. For me, this took any real sort of emotional sting out of the tail and just left me feeling flat.

Arguably one of the most darkest movies in the MCU. Highly recommend for parents to advise their children since the events of this movie would hurt them emotionally. Overall great movie with tons of action and comedy fit into this major blockbuster!

Not one the best but the best comic book movie of all time.
Epic Classic Fantastic
Emotional Comedic Gigantic fight pieces romance
Omg what else can u accept
Outstanding performances by Thanos aka Josh Iron man Spidy Dr strange Thor Gamora n wow Bruce Banner......spcl mention love u roosos
This movie is simply amazing.  I had my doubts they'd be able to pull off a great movie with 10 years of hype building up to it, but they did it!

Infinty war suffers from waaay too many characters, massive overuse of cgi, which doesn't hold up as much as promised. The story is... okay at it's beat, but way too predictable and contains quite a lot of plotholes that people just seem to ignore... 
The villain is also very overrated, even though his doings at first seems understandeable, they're not. If you were to eliminate half the population of the universe, you have to think about the after math. So many people would be depressed and kill themself. And many leaders would die, and this would lead to wars over resources. After all this film does really disapoint, but since my hopes weren't that high for the film, it still gets 2/5 stars.
All I can say is OMFG. Now the long torturous wait begins.

This movie is excellent! It leaves Marvel fans feeling like the last 10 years of world building and character development really meant something in the story. If treats the fans like fans,  having assumed that you know these characters and do not need another origin story for every hero.  And most importantly it avoids what the Last Jedi did and allows you to get lost in the Marvel MCU without drowning you in personalized agenda and social justice messages that might otherwise rob the film of character and story. Thank you Marvel for caring about and respecting your fans rather than trying to lecture and shame us . Long live Marvel, king of the Box Office.
